thread.title: Phillipsburg football has dominated New Jersey opponents over the last two decades
thread.title_full: Phillipsburg football has dominated New Jersey opponents over the last two decades

title: Phillipsburg football has dominated New Jersey opponents over the last two decades
text:
By Tom Hinkel | For lehighvalleylive.com on October 05, 2015 4:53 PM, updated October 05, 2015 5:07 PM View/Post Comments 
It’s hard to believe it’s been 20 years already since Phillipsburg High School’s football program joined forces with the old Skyland Conference in New Jersey to accommodate NJSIAA mandated rules to qualify for the state playoffs. 
Since that time, the Stateliners’ football program, in particular, has fared quite well against its foes from the Garden State. 
P’burg, which now plays in the Mid-State 38 Conference Delaware Division, has a winning record against every team it’s played with any type of regularity except Hunterdon Central. 
P’burg has been especially efficient since the turn of the century. For example, the Stateliners lost five straight to Franklin from 1995-99 before running off seven straight wins against the Warriors from 2000-06. 
Overall, P’burg holds a 14-9 mark against Franklin including last Friday’s 42-6 romp at Maloney Stadium. P’burg has played Franklin more than any other team since ’95 because the teams have also met twice in the state playoffs. 
RELATED : Complete coverage: Phillipsburg football team trounces Franklin 
Some may not remember, but another team that started out as a stumbling block for P’burg was Hillsborough, the Stateliners’ opponent on Friday night. P’burg beat Hillsborough in ’95 but lost the next five meetings with the Raiders from 1996-2000. 
P’burg has since recovered nicely in its series with Hillsborough. The Stateliners won the next 11 meetings with the Raiders before last season’s 14-13 loss at Maloney Stadium, P’burg’s only setback of 2014. Overall, P’burg owns a 13-7 advantage over Hillsborough since ’95. 
P’burg, which has captured six sectional titles over that 20-year span, has dominated its recent series with North Hunterdon (16-1) with the only loss being a 14-12 setback in 1997. 
The Stateliners have also had major success against Warren Hills (12-3) and Bridgewater (15-5). The Stateliners still have never lost to Watchung Hills since the move in '95, owning a 16-0 mark against the Warriors. 
Amongst teams its played less frequently, P’burg also has winning records against Ridge (3-1), Elizabeth (4-2), Union (5-1) and Westfield (3-0) since ’95. 
The one team in New Jersey that’s easily given P’burg the most trouble is Hunterdon Central. The Red Devils own a 12-8 mark over the Stateliners since ’95, although P’burg has won the last two meetings and will probably be favored to win again this year when the teams meet on Oct. 23 at Maloney Stadium. 
The P’burg-Hunterdon Central series was actually tied 6-6 before the Red Devils ran off six straight wins from 2007-12. 
With 667 victories, P’burg continues to be the winningest football program in New Jersey. Certainly that takes longevity, and Phillipsburg has been playing football for 111 years. 
However, the one overriding factor is the pride, tradition and commitment to excellence that the program has sustained for more than a century.
